border-radius: 8px;\">\n    <h3 style=\"text-align: center; margin: 0 0 10px;\">Starlink Group 6-110</h3>\n    <img src=\"https://thespacedevs-prod.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/media/images/falcon_9_image_20230807133459.jpeg\" alt=\"Falcon 9\" style=\"max-width: 100%; height: auto; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 10px;\">\n    <p style=\"text-align: left; margin: 0; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5;\">\n      <strong>Launch Provider:</strong> SpaceX - Commercial<br>\n      <strong>Launch Date:</strong> February 24, 2026<br>\n      <strong>Launch Time:</strong> 8:56 PM UTC<br>\n      <strong>Vehicle:</strong> Falcon 9<br>\n      <strong>Brief:</strong> A batch of 29 satellites for the Starlink mega-constellation - SpaceX's project for space-based Internet communication system.<br><br>\n      <a href=\"https://x.com/i/broadcasts/1vAGRQDBVXZKl\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"text-decoration: none; font-weight: bold;\">🚀 Watch Livestream</a>\n    </p>\n  </div>\n\n  <!-- CARD 5 -->\n  <div style=\"border: 3px solid; padding: 15px; margin-bottom: 15px; max-width: 450px; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; border-radius: 8px;\">\n    <h3 style=\"text-align: center; margin: 0 0 10px;\">Starlink Group 6-108</h3>\n    <img src=\"https://thespacedevs-prod.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/media/images/falcon_9_image_20230807133459.jpeg\" alt=\"Falcon 9\" style=\"max-width: 100%; height: auto; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 10px;\">\n    <p style=\"text-align: left; margin: 0; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5;\">\n      <strong>Launch Provider:</strong> SpaceX - Commercial<br>\n      <strong>Launch Date:</strong> February 27, 2026<br>\n      <strong>Launch Time:</strong> 9:52 AM UTC<br>\n      <strong>Vehicle:</strong> Falcon 9<br>\n      <strong>Brief:</strong> A batch of 29 satellites for the Starlink mega-constellation - SpaceX's project for space-based Internet communication system.<br><br>\n      <a href=\"https://x.com/i/broadcasts/1DXxyWWBAMgGM\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"text-decoration: none; font-weight: bold;\">🚀 Watch Livestream</a>\n    </p>\n  </div>\n</div>",
                            "rendered": "<p><img decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" src=\"https://www.nasaspaceflight.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/NSF-2026-02-21-20-33-45-477-wmarked.jpg\" alt=\"NASA's Space Launch System rocket for Artemis II on Launch Pad 39B at Kennedy Space Center\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\"></p>\n<h3>Artemis II Likely Rolling Back Amid Helium Glitch</h3>\n<p>Just one day after NASA optimistically targeted March 6, 2026 as the launch date for Artemis II, the agency is now preparing to roll the massive Space Launch System (SLS) rocket back to the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB) at Kennedy Space Center. The reason? An unexpected interruption in helium flow within the Interim Cryogenic Propulsion Stage (ICPS)—the upper stage derived from the Delta IV—detected during routine operations on the evening of February 21.</p>\n<p>Helium is critical for purging engine lines and pressurizing the liquid hydrogen and oxygen tanks during flight. Although the system performed flawlessly during two recent Wet Dress Rehearsals, this new anomaly has halted final launch preparations. According to NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman, “Regardless of the potential fault, accessing and remediating any of these issues can only be performed in the VAB.” As a result, engineers have begun removing newly installed pad access platforms ahead of forecasted high winds on February 22—work that must be completed before any rollback can proceed.</p>\n<p>With the March 6–11 launch window now “almost assuredly” off the table, attention shifts to the next viable opportunity: April 1–6, 2026. The mission, which aims to send four astronauts—including Canadian Jeremy Hansen—on a lunar flyby, remains a cornerstone of NASA’s return-to-the-<a href=\"https://amzn.to/3JE1eAM\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" ;\">Moon</a> programme. While disappointing, Isaacman reminded the public that even Apollo faced numerous setbacks before success.</p>\n<p><img decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" src=\"http://spaceflightnow.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/20260221-SLS_pad_shot_ICPS.jpeg\" alt=\"Close-up of the SLS rocket's upper stage at Launch Pad 39B\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\"></p>\n<h3>SpaceX Sets New Reusability Milestone with 33rd Booster Flight</h3>\n<p>While NASA grapples with delays, <a href=\"https://amzn.to/4oREo7N\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" ;\">SpaceX</a> quietly notched another record in the reusability playbook. On February 21, 2026 at 10:47 p.m. EST, <a href=\"https://amzn.to/498VWI9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" ;\">Falcon 9</a> booster B1067 launched for its 33rd time—the most of any orbital-class rocket booster in history. The flight, designated Starlink 6-104, delivered 28 more broadband satellites to low <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3JLwvlp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" ;\">Earth</a> orbit from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.</p>\n<p>Nearly 8.5 minutes after liftoff, B1067 touched down on the droneship <em>A Shortfall of Gravitas</em> in the Atlantic Ocean, marking SpaceX’s 575th successful booster landing overall. This particular booster’s resume includes four NASA missions, the European Commission’s Galileo L13 satellite, and 20 previous Starlink batches. With SpaceX now certifying boosters for up to 40 flights, B1067 still has room to fly.</p>\n<p>The mission further expands SpaceX’s Starlink constellation, which now exceeds 9,700 satellites. While routine by SpaceX standards, this flight underscores the dramatic transformation in launch economics driven by reusability—a stark contrast to the bespoke, single-use approach of SLS.</p>\n<p><img decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" src=\"http://spaceflightnow.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/20260221_Starlink_6-104_MC-1.jpeg\" alt=\"Falcon 9 launching Starlink satellites with booster B1067 on its 33rd flight\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\"></p>\n<h3>European Defence Tensions Rise Over Mynaric Acquisition Battle</h3>\n<p>In a behind-the-scenes drama with geopolitical stakes, German defence giant Rheinmetall is reportedly weighing a bid to acquire Mynaric, a Munich-based maker of laser communications terminals—potentially derailing Rocket Lab’s planned $150 million purchase announced nearly a year ago. The move reflects growing European anxiety over foreign control of critical space technologies, particularly in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and questions about long-term U.S. security commitments.</p>\n<p>Mynaric’s CONDOR Mk3 optical terminals enable high-speed, secure data transfer between satellites using laser links—technology now flying on U.S. Space Development Agency satellites for missile tracking and resilient military communications. While Rocket Lab, a U.S.-New Zealand company, sees the acquisition as a way to vertically integrate its satellite manufacturing, German regulators have yet to approve the deal under foreign investment rules. Now, Rheinmetall’s potential counteroffer could keep the technology firmly under European sovereignty.</p>\n<p>For Canada and other NATO allies, the outcome matters: laser communications are becoming essential for next-generation defence constellations. If Europe opts for domestic control, it may spur similar policies elsewhere—reshaping how Western nations collaborate on secure space infrastructure in an increasingly fragmented global landscape.</p>\n<p><img decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" src=\"https://spacenews.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/FocqgZhaUAECh_z-scaled.jpeg\" alt=\"Mynaric laser communication terminal undergoing testing\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\"></p>\n<h3>Citations</h3>\n<ul>\n<li>&#8220;NASA prepares for likely rollback of SLS, delaying Artemis II to April&#8221; &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.nasaspaceflight.com/2026/02/nasa-rollback-sls-delaying-artemis-april/\">https://www.nasaspaceflight.com/2026/02/nasa-rollback-sls-delaying-artemis-april/</a></li>\n<li>&#8220;SpaceX’s most-flown Falcon booster launches on record 33rd flight&#8221; &#8211; <a href=\"https://spaceflightnow.com/2026/02/21/live-coverage-spacexs-most-flown-falcon-booster-to-launch-on-record-33rd-flight/\">https://spaceflightnow.com/2026/02/21/live-coverage-spacexs-most-flown-falcon-booster-to-launch-on-record-33rd-flight/</a></li>\n<li>&#8220;German defense firm said to be weighing bid for Mynaric&#8221; &#8211; <a href=\"https://spacenews.com/german-defense-firm-said-to-be-weighing-bid-for-mynaric/\">https://spacenews.com/german-defense-firm-said-to-be-weighing-bid-for-mynaric/</a></li>\n</ul>\n<div style=\"display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto; padding: 20px;\">\n<h1 style=\"text-align: center;\">Upcoming Launches</h1>\n<p></p>\n<p>  <!-- CARD 1 --></p>\n<div style=\"border: 3px solid; Write naturally without forcing stereotypes.\n\n## TODAY'S DATE AND TEMPORAL ACCURACY - CRITICAL\n- TODAY'S DATE: - TODAY'S DATE AND TIME: {{ $now.toFormat('MMMM d, yyyy \\'at\\' h:mm a') }} EST\n- Articles may discuss FUTURE events - do NOT report them as already completed\n- Use proper tense:\n  - Past tense: \"SpaceX launched...\" (for completed events)\n  - Future tense: \"SpaceX is scheduled to launch...\" or \"will launch...\" (for upcoming events)\n- If an article discusses a scheduled launch/event, clearly state it has NOT happened yet\n- Include specific dates/times for future events when available\n- VERIFY: Does the article say it happened, or that it WILL happen?\n- When uncertain about timing, check for keywords: \"scheduled\", \"planned\", \"upcoming\", \"will\", \"expected to\"\n\n## Format Requirements\n- Use HTML5 tags ONLY: <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <p>, <strong>, <em>, <ul>, <li>, <a>, <img>\n- DO NOT set: font-family, max-width, font-size, or any CSS styling\n- Images: Use <img src=\"URL\" alt=\"description\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\">\n\n## Writing Style\n- Clear and concise - easy to read\n- Informative - convey interesting facts accurately\n- Do not make assumptions or speculate\n- Add subtle humor where appropriate\n- Maintain a conversational but professional tone\n\n## Canadian Perspective\n- Highlight Canadian connections when they exist (missions, technology, astronauts, companies)\n- Use Canadian spelling (favour, colour, centre, programme)\n- Include context relevant to Canadian readers where appropriate\n- Don't force it - only mention Canada when naturally relevant\n\n## Source Materials (Past 24 Hours Only)\nArticles from past 24 hours: {{ $node[\"Article Final Prep\"].json.combined_article_markdown }}\nEvents from past 24 hours: {{ $node[\"Event Final Prep\"].json.combined_events_markdown }}\nSpaceQ articles from past 24 hours: {{ $node[\"SpaceQ Final Prep\"].json.combined_spaceq_markdown }}\n\nYesterday's post citations (DO NOT reuse these sources): {{ $json.text }}\nNote: You may reference the same events if they're ongoing, but must find new source articles about them.\n\n## Available Images\n- Use images from the articles, blogs, reports, and events provided in the source materials\n- Extract image URLs from the markdown content\n- Prioritize high-quality, relevant images that illustrate the stories\n- If no suitable images are available for any story, it's acceptable to omit images entirely\n\n## Story Selection Process\nSelect THREE stories using this priority system:\n\n**Priority 1 - Breaking News:**\n- Unscheduled launches, rocket explosions, satellite re-entries, mission failures\n- Major accidents or anomalies\n- If discussing accidents/damage: be respectful, factual, avoid speculation\n- Only select breaking news if it occurred in the past 24 hours\n\n**Priority 2 - Regional Interest (Max 1 Story):**\n- Canadian space projects or missions\n- Canadian involvement in international space missions\n- Canadian commercial launch industry news\n- Canadian astronauts or space agencies\n- LIMIT: Maximum ONE story from this category\n\n**Priority 3 - Major Programs (in order of priority):**\n1. SpaceX Starship/Starbase missions or news\n2. Artemis/Orion programme updates\n3. Rocket Lab missions or news\n4. Blue Origin missions or news\n5. Other major launch providers\n\n**Priority 4 - General Interest:**\n- Stories that would interest aerospace enthusiasts\n- Technical innovations or breakthroughs\n- First-time achievements or milestones\n- Industry developments or partnerships\n- Scientific discoveries from space missions\n\n**Fallback:**\nIf none of the above apply, choose the three most interesting or significant stories from the available sources.\n\n## Article Structure\n\n**Header Image:**\n- Use image from first story (if available)\n- If not available, use image from second story\n- If not available, use image from third story\n- If no images available, omit header image entirely\n- Center the image using: <img src=\"URL\" alt=\"description\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\">\n\n**Title:**\n- Create one <h1> heading that ties together the theme of all three stories\n- Format: <h1>Your Creative Title Here</h1>\n- Make it engaging and reflective of the day's aerospace developments\n\n**Story Format:**\n- Each story gets its own <h3> subheading\n- Write 150-300 words per story (this is a flexible range, not a strict requirement)\n- Include relevant images within each story section if available\n- Use format: <img src=\"URL\" alt=\"description\" style=\"display:block; margin:0 auto;\">\n- Be factual - cite specific dates, times, numbers, and details from sources\n- Include mission names, vehicle names, or company names when available\n- Connect stories thematically where relevant\n- Clearly distinguish between completed events and scheduled/upcoming events\n\n**Citations Section:**\nAt the end, add:\n<h3>Citations</h3>\n<ul>\n    <li>\"Article Title\" - <a href=\"full_url\">full_url</a></li>\n    <li>\"Article Title\" - <a href=\"full_url\">full_url</a></li>\n    <li>\"Article Title\" - <a href=\"full_url\">full_url</a></li>\n</ul>\n\nInclude ALL sources referenced in your post.\n\n## Content Guidelines\n- Use specific dates, times, and numbers from source material\n- Include mission names, vehicle names, launch providers, and specific details\n- Cite tweets or social media posts when referencing them\n- Each story should be 200-500 words (flexible guideline)\n- Connect related stories thematically when possible\n- Maintain factual accuracy - no speculation or assumptions\n- Distinguish clearly between past events (already happened) and scheduled/upcoming events (will happen)\n- Never report future events as if they've already occurred\n- For scheduled launches: include the planned date/time and use future tense\n\n## Final Checks\n- Did you avoid reusing yesterday's source articles?\n- Did you include 3 distinct stories?\n- Did you limit Priority 2 (Regional Interest) stories to MAX 1?\n- Is each story approximately 200-500 words?\n- Are all citations present and correctly formatted?\n- Are images centered with proper HTML format?\n- Is all HTML valid (no CSS styling except image centering)?\n- Does the title tie the three stories together thematically?\n- Did you use Canadian spelling where appropriate?\n- Did you correctly distinguish between completed and upcoming events?\n- Did you verify the timing of all events mentioned?\n\n## Output Format\nReturn ONLY the HTML article content with no preamble, explanations, or markdown code blocks.\nStart directly with the header image (if available) and <h1> title, followed by the three stories and citations.\n\nBegin writing the daily aerospace blog post now.",

              "jsCode": "// === AFFILIATE LINK INJECTOR - REMOVE ONLY THE MAIN H1 TITLE ===\nconst debugLogs = [];\n\n// Get LLM output\nconst llmText = $('Write Todays Space News').first().json.text || '';\n\ndebugLogs.push('LLM text loaded successfully');\ndebugLogs.push(`LLM text length: ${llmText.length}`);\n\n// === REMOVE ONLY THE FIRST <h1>…</h1> (the main blog title) ===\nlet textWithoutH1 = llmText;\nconst firstH1 = llmText.match(/<h1[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/h1>/i);  // matches first h1 only\nif (firstH1) {\n  textWithoutH1 = llmText.replace(firstH1[0], '');\n  debugLogs.push(`Removed main H1 title: \"${firstH1[0].replace(/<[^>]*>/g, '').trim()}\"`);\n} else {\n  debugLogs.push('No <h1> found – nothing removed');\n}\n\n// Get ALL product inputs (unchanged)\nconst allInputs = $input.all();\nconst products = [];\nallInputs.forEach((input) => {\n  if (input.json && input.json.keyword) {\n    products.push(input.json  );\n  }\n});\ndebugLogs.push(`Collected ${products.length} products`);\n\nif (products.length === 0) {\n  return [{\n    json: {\n      enhanced_post: textWithoutH1,\n      links_added: 0,\n      error: 'No products found',\n      debug_logs: debugLogs\n    }\n  }];\n}\n\n// Build keyword map (unchanged)\nconst keywordMap = {};\nproducts.forEach(p => {\n  const kw = (p.keyword || '').toString().trim().toLowerCase();\n  if (!kw) return;\n  if (!keywordMap[kw]) keywordMap[kw] = [];\n  keywordMap[kw].push({\n    url: p.url,\n    text: p.text || p.product,\n    originalKeyword: p.keyword\n  });\n});\n\nconst keywords = Object.keys(keywordMap).sort((a, b) => b.length - a.length);\ndebugLogs.push(`Unique keywords (${keywords.length}): ${keywords.join(', ')}`);\n\n// Split content into sections – now using textWithoutH1\nconst sections = [];\nlet currentPos = 0;\nconst headingRegex = /<h[1-6][^>]*>.*?<\\/h[1-6]>/gi;  // still skips h2–h6 too\nlet match;\n\nwhile ((match = headingRegex.exec(textWithoutH1)) !== null) {\n  if (match.index > currentPos) {\n    sections.push({\n      text: textWithoutH1.substring(currentPos, match.index),\n      isHeading: false\n    });\n  }\n  sections.push({\n    text: match[0],\n    isHeading: true\n  });\n  currentPos = match.index + match[0].length;\n}\nif (currentPos < textWithoutH1.length) {\n  sections.push({\n    text: textWithoutH1.substring(currentPos),\n    isHeading: false\n  });\n}\n\ndebugLogs.push(`Split into ${sections.length} sections (headings + content)`);\n\n// Process only non-heading sections (unchanged)\nconst linkedKeywords = [];\nconst maxLinks = 5;\n\nsections.forEach(section => {\n  if (section.isHeading || linkedKeywords.length >= maxLinks) return;\n\n  keywords.forEach(keyword => {\n    if (linkedKeywords.length >= maxLinks) return;\n\n    const lowerText = section.text.toLowerCase();\n    if (!lowerText.includes(keyword)) return;\n    if (linkedKeywords.find(lk => lk.keyword === keyword)) return;\n\n    debugLogs.push(`\"${keyword}\" found in content`);\n\n    const escapedKeyword = keyword.replace(/[.*+?^${}()|[\\]\\\\]/g, '\\\\$&');\n    const regex = new RegExp('\\\\b(' + escapedKeyword + ')\\\\b', 'i');\n    const match = section.text.match(regex);\n    if (!match) return;\n\n    const productList = keywordMap[keyword];\n    const randomProduct = productList[Math.floor(Math.random() * productList.length)];\n\n    debugLogs.push(` → Selected: ${randomProduct.text} (${productList.length} options)`);\n\n    const link = `<a href=\"${randomProduct.url}\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" ;\">$1</a>`;\n    section.text = section.text.replace(regex, link);\n\n    linkedKeywords.push({\n      keyword,\n      product: randomProduct.text,\n      url: randomProduct.url\n    });\n  });\n});\n\n// Reconstruct final text\nconst finalText = sections.map(s => s.text).join('');\n\ndebugLogs.push(`=== FINAL: ${linkedKeywords.length} links added ===`);\nif (linkedKeywords.length > 0) {\n  debugLogs.push(`Linked: ${linkedKeywords.map(k => `${k.keyword} → ${k.product}`).join(', ')}`);\n}\n\nreturn [{\n  json: {\n    enhanced_post: finalText,\n    links_added: linkedKeywords.length,\n    linked_products: linkedKeywords,\n    debug_logs: debugLogs\n  }\n}];",

              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// SpaceQ Article Cleanup Code Node\n// Extracts and cleans article content from SpaceQ HTML scrapes\n// Input: item.json.article or item.json.data or item.json.body or item.json.html contains HTML string\n// Output: {title, url, date, thumbnail, images[], source, content, raw_html_content, word_count, character_count, has_content}\n\nconst items = $input.all();\nconst results = [];\n\nfor (const item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get HTML content from various possible field names\n    let htmlContent = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!htmlContent) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'SpaceQ',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from h1.entry-title\n    const titleMatch = htmlContent.match(/<h1 class=\"entry-title[^\"]*\">\\s*([^<]+)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    const title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    const urlMatch = htmlContent.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    const url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : item.json.url || '';\n\n    // Extract date from time.entry-date\n    const dateMatch = htmlContent.match(/<time class=\"entry-date[^\"]*\" datetime=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>([^<]+)<\\/time>/);\n    const date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[2].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract featured image from og:image meta tag\n    const thumbnailMatch = htmlContent.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n    // Strip query parameters from thumbnail\n    if (thumbnail) {\n      thumbnail = thumbnail.split('?')[0];\n    }\n\n    // Extract main article content from div.entry-content\n    const contentStartMatch = htmlContent.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">/);\n    if (!contentStartMatch) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'Article content not found',\n          title,\n          url,\n          date,\n          thumbnail,\n          images: [],\n          source: 'SpaceQ',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    const startIndex = contentStartMatch.index + contentStartMatch[0].length;\n    const afterContent = htmlContent.substring(startIndex);\n    // Find closing </div><!-- .entry-content -->\n    const endMatch = afterContent.search(/<\\/div><!-- \\.entry-content -->/);\n    const allArticleContent = endMatch > 0 ? afterContent.substring(0, endMatch) : afterContent;\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements before text extraction\n    let cleaned = allArticleContent;\n    \n    // Remove style blocks\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove script blocks\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove related posts section (jp-relatedposts)\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*id=['\"]jp-relatedposts['\"][^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove figure elements (images will be extracted separately)\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<figure[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove iframes\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<iframe[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/iframe>/gi, '');\n\n    // Extract images from article content (before cleaning)\n    const images = [];\n    const imgRegex = /<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g;\n    let imgMatch;\n    while ((imgMatch = imgRegex.exec(allArticleContent)) !== null) {\n      let imgSrc = imgMatch[1];\n      // Skip lazy-load placeholders and small images\n      if (!imgSrc.includes('data:image/svg') && \n          !imgSrc.includes('base64') &&\n          !imgSrc.includes('gravatar') &&\n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp'))) {\n        // Strip query parameters\n        imgSrc = imgSrc.split('?')[0];\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // If no images found in content but we have a thumbnail, use that\n    if (images.length === 0 && thumbnail) {\n      images.push(thumbnail);\n    }\n\n    // Strip all HTML tags\n    let textContent = cleaned.replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ');\n    \n    // Decode HTML entities\n    textContent = textContent\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')\n      .replace(/&#x27;/g, \"'\")\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—');\n    \n    // Collapse multiple spaces and newlines\n    textContent = textContent.replace(/\\s+/g, ' ').trim();\n    \n    // Calculate metrics\n    const wordCount = textContent.split(/\\s+/).filter(word => word.length > 0).length;\n    const characterCount = textContent.length;\n    const hasContent = textContent.length > 0;\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title,\n        url,\n        date,\n        thumbnail,\n        images,\n        source: 'SpaceQ',\n        content: textContent,\n        raw_html_content: allArticleContent,\n        word_count: wordCount,\n        character_count: characterCount,\n        has_content: hasContent\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'SpaceQ',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// Ars Technica Article Cleanup Code Node\n// Extracts and cleans article content from scraped Ars Technica pages\n// Expects: scraped HTML with metadata from extraction node\n\n// Process all items from the loop\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML content from various possible field names\n    let htmlContent = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!htmlContent) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'Ars Technica',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n  \n  // Extract title from <h1> tag with specific Ars Technica classes\n  const titleRegex = /<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*font-serif[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/h1>/;\n  const titleMatch = htmlContent.match(titleRegex);\n  let title = '';\n  if (titleMatch && titleMatch[1]) {\n    title = titleMatch[1]\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, '')\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')\n      .replace(/&#x27;/g, \"'\")\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')\n      .trim();\n  }\n  \n  // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n  const urlRegex = /<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\">/;\n  const urlMatch = htmlContent.match(urlRegex);\n  let articleUrl = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n  \n  // Extract publish date from JSON-LD schema\n  const dateRegex = /\"datePublished\":\"([^\"]+)\"/;\n  const dateMatch = htmlContent.match(dateRegex);\n  let publishDate = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1] : '';\n  \n  // Extract featured image from og:image meta tag\n  const imageRegex = /<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\">/;\n  const imageMatch = htmlContent.match(imageRegex);\n  let featuredImage = imageMatch ? imageMatch[1] : '';\n  \n  // Extract ALL post-content divs (article is split across multiple sections)\n  const contentPattern = /<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*post-content[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>/g;\n  const contentMatches = htmlContent.match(contentPattern);\n  let allArticleContent = '';\n  if (contentMatches) {\n    allArticleContent = contentMatches.join('\\n\\n');\n  }\n  \n  let cleanContent = '';\n  let articleImages = [];\n  \n  if (allArticleContent) {\n    // Clean up the HTML - remove unwanted elements first\n    let cleaned = allArticleContent\n      // Remove style blocks\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')\n      // Remove script blocks\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '')\n      // Remove ad divs\n      .replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*teads[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '')\n      .replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*cns-ads[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '')\n      // Remove interlude/video player containers\n      .replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*ars-interlude[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>/gi, '')\n      .replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*cne-interlude[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '')\n      // Remove author bio sections (must be before general div cleanup)\n      .replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*author-mini-bio[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*$/gi, '')\n      .replace(/<aside[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/aside>/gi, '')\n      // Remove figure tags with captions\n      .replace(/<figure[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/gi, '')\n      // Remove iframes\n      .replace(/<iframe[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/iframe>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Extract all images from cleaned content (after author bio removal)\n    const imagePattern = /<img[^>]+src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g;\n    const articleImages = [];\n    let imgMatch;\n    while ((imgMatch = imagePattern.exec(cleaned)) !== null) {\n      if (imgMatch[1] && !imgMatch[1].includes('data:image')) {\n        articleImages.push(imgMatch[1]);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    // Now clean up text formatting\n    cleanContent = cleaned\n      .replace(/<br\\s*\\/?>/gi, '\\n')           // Convert <br> to newlines\n      .replace(/<\\/p>/gi, '\\n\\n')              // Convert </p> to double newlines\n      .replace(/<p[^>]*>/gi, '')               // Remove <p> tags\n      .replace(/<\\/h[1-6]>/gi, '\\n\\n')         // Convert heading closures to newlines\n      .replace(/<h[1-6][^>]*>/gi, '')          // Remove heading tags\n      .replace(/<strong>/gi, '')               // Remove <strong> tags\n      .replace(/<\\/strong>/gi, '')             // Remove </strong> tags\n      .replace(/<em>/gi, '')                   // Remove <em> tags\n      .replace(/<\\/em>/gi, '')                 // Remove </em> tags\n      .replace(/<a[^>]*>/gi, '')               // Remove <a> tags\n      .replace(/<\\/a>/gi, '')                  // Remove </a> tags\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, '')                 // Remove all other HTML tags\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                 // Replace &nbsp; with space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                  // Replace &amp; with &\n      .replace(/&#x27;/g, \"'\")                 // Replace &#x27; with '\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                 // Replace &quot; with \"\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                   // Replace &lt; with <\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                   // Replace &gt; with >\n      .replace(/\\n\\s*\\n\\s*\\n+/g, '\\n\\n')       // Collapse multiple newlines\n      .trim();                                  // Trim whitespace\n  }\n  \n  // Add to results array\n  results.push({\n    json: {\n      title: title,\n      url: articleUrl,\n      date: publishDate,\n      thumbnail: featuredImage,\n      images: articleImages,\n      source: 'Ars Technica',\n      content: cleanContent,\n      raw_html_content: allArticleContent,\n      word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n      character_count: cleanContent.length,\n      has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n    }\n  });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'Ars Technica',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\n// Return all processed articles\nreturn results;\n",
              "notice": ""

              "content": "##  ESA Article Scrape",
              "height": 224,
              "width": 832,
              "color": 2
            },
            "type": "n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote",
            "position": [
              2992,
              -864

            "typeVersion": 1,
            "id": "3b3fd62f-0005-4153-971d-795f3b9402b0",
            "name": "Sticky Note4"
          },
          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// ESA Article Cleanup Code Node\n// Extracts and cleans article content from ESA HTML scrapes\n// Input: item.json.data or item.json.body contains HTML string\n// Output: {title, url, date, thumbnail, images[], source, content, raw_html_content, word_count, character_count, has_content}\n\nconst items = $input.all();\nconst results = [];\n\nfor (const item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get HTML content from various possible field names\n    let htmlContent = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!htmlContent) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'ESA',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from h1.heading.heading--main\n    const titleMatch = htmlContent.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*heading heading--main[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/h1>/);\n    const title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim().replace(/<[^>]+>/g, '').trim() : '';\n\n    // Construct URL from breadcrumb path and title\n    // ESA URLs follow pattern: https://www.esa.int/category/subcategory/Title_with_underscores\n    let url = item.json.url || '';\n    if (!url) {\n      // Extract the last (most specific) breadcrumb path\n      const breadcrumbSection = htmlContent.match(/<div class=\"breadcrumbs article__block article__item\">([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/div>/);\n      if (breadcrumbSection) {\n        const breadcrumbLinks = breadcrumbSection[1].match(/href=\"([^\"]+)\"/g);\n        if (breadcrumbLinks && breadcrumbLinks.length > 0) {\n          // Get the last breadcrumb path\n          const lastLink = breadcrumbLinks[breadcrumbLinks.length - 1];\n          const lastPath = lastLink.match(/href=\"([^\"]+)\"/)[1];\n          const urlTitle = title.replace(/\\s+/g, '_').replace(/[^a-zA-Z0-9_-]/g, '');\n          url = `https://www.esa.int${lastPath}/${urlTitle}`;\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Extract date from meta span (format: DD/MM/YYYY)\n    const dateMatch = htmlContent.match(/<div class=\"meta article__item\">[\\s\\S]*?<span>(\\d{2}\\/\\d{2}\\/\\d{4})<\\/span>/);\n    const date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract featured image from og:image meta tag\n    const thumbnailMatch = htmlContent.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\">/);\n    const thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract abstract (includes update text if present)\n    const abstractMatch = htmlContent.match(/<div class=\"abstract article__block article__item\">([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/div>/);\n    const abstractHtml = abstractMatch ? abstractMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article area (from article tag to share section)\n    const articleMatch = htmlContent.match(/<article class=\"article[^\"]*\">([\\s\\S]*?)(?:<div class=\"share button-group|<\\/article>)/);\n    const articleArea = articleMatch ? articleMatch[1] : htmlContent;\n\n    // Extract all article__block divs content more reliably\n    const articleBlocks = [];\n    const blockStarts = [];\n    \n    // Find all starting positions of article__block divs\n    let searchStart = 0;\n    while (true) {\n      const blockStart = articleArea.indexOf('<div class=\"article__block\"', searchStart);\n      if (blockStart === -1) break;\n      blockStarts.push(blockStart);\n      searchStart = blockStart + 1;\n    }\n    \n    // For each block start, find its content up to the next block or end\n    for (let i = 0; i < blockStarts.length; i++) {\n      const start = blockStarts[i];\n      const end = i < blockStarts.length - 1 ? blockStarts[i + 1] : articleArea.length;\n      const blockContent = articleArea.substring(start, end);\n      // Only add if it's not the abstract (we already have that)\n      if (!blockContent.includes('class=\"abstract article__block')) {\n        articleBlocks.push(blockContent);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Combine abstract and article blocks\n    let allArticleContent = abstractHtml + '\\n' + articleBlocks.join('\\n');\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements before text extraction\n    let cleaned = allArticleContent;\n    \n    // Remove style blocks\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove script blocks\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove video elements\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*article__video[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove share buttons and social media links\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*share[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*a2a_kit[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove figure elements (images will be extracted separately)\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<figure[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove iframes\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<iframe[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/iframe>/gi, '');\n\n    // Extract images from article content (before removing them)\n    // Focus on images within article__image figures to avoid navigation/sidebar images\n    const images = [];\n    \n    // First try to get images from article__image figures\n    const articleImageRegex = /<figure class=\"article__image[^\"]*\">[\\s\\S]*?<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/g;\n    let articleImgMatch;\n    while ((articleImgMatch = articleImageRegex.exec(allArticleContent)) !== null) {\n      const imgSrc = articleImgMatch[1];\n      const fullImgSrc = imgSrc.startsWith('http') ? imgSrc : `https://www.esa.int${imgSrc}`;\n      if (!images.includes(fullImgSrc)) {\n        images.push(fullImgSrc);\n      }\n    }\n    \n    // If no article__image figures found, fall back to all images in article blocks\n    if (images.length === 0) {\n      const imgRegex = /<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g;\n      let imgMatch;\n      while ((imgMatch = imgRegex.exec(allArticleContent)) !== null) {\n        const imgSrc = imgMatch[1];\n        // Skip small images (likely icons) and non-article images\n        if (imgSrc.includes('_article.') || imgSrc.includes('/esa_multimedia/images/')) {\n          const fullImgSrc = imgSrc.startsWith('http') ? imgSrc : `https://www.esa.int${imgSrc}`;\n          if (!images.includes(fullImgSrc)) {\n            images.push(fullImgSrc);\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Strip all HTML tags\n    let textContent = cleaned.replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ');\n    \n    // Decode HTML entities\n    textContent = textContent\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')\n      .replace(/&#x27;/g, \"'\")\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>');\n    \n    // Collapse multiple spaces and newlines\n    textContent = textContent.replace(/\\s+/g, ' ').trim();\n    \n    // Calculate metrics\n    const wordCount = textContent.split(/\\s+/).filter(word => word.length > 0).length;\n    const characterCount = textContent.length;\n    const hasContent = textContent.length > 0;\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title,\n        url,\n        date,\n        thumbnail,\n        images,\n        source: 'ESA',\n        content: textContent,\n        raw_html_content: allArticleContent,\n        word_count: wordCount,\n        character_count: characterCount,\n        has_content: hasContent\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'ESA',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

contains HTML string\n// Output: {title, url, date, thumbnail, images[], source, content, raw_html_content, word_count, character_count, has_content}\n\nconst items = $input.all();\nconst results = [];\n\nfor (const item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get HTML content from various possible field names\n    let htmlContent = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!htmlContent) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'European Spaceflight',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: class=\"entry-title\">([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/h1>/);\n    const title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    const urlMatch = htmlContent.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    const url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : item.json.url || '';\n\n    // Extract date from time.entry-date\n    const dateMatch = htmlContent.match(/<time class=\"entry-date[^\"]*\" datetime=\"[^\"]*\" ?>([^<]+)<\\/time>/);\n    const date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract featured image from og:image meta tag\n    const thumbnailMatch = htmlContent.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    const thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract main article content from td-post-content div\n    // Find the start of td-post-content\n    const contentStartMatch = htmlContent.match(/<div class=\"td-post-content tagdiv-type\">/);\n    if (!contentStartMatch) {\n      // Try without the closing tag constraint - get everything after td-post-content starts\n      const simpleMatch = htmlContent.match(/<div class=\"td-post-content[^>]*\">([\\s\\S]*)/);\n      allArticleContent = simpleMatch ? simpleMatch[1] : '';\n    } else {\n      const startIndex = contentStartMatch.index + contentStartMatch[0].length;\n      // Find the closing of this div by looking for the article tag or footer\n      const afterContent = htmlContent.substring(startIndex);\n      const endMatch = afterContent.search(/<\\/div>\\s*<\\/article>|<footer/);\n      allArticleContent = endMatch > 0 ? afterContent.substring(0, endMatch) : afterContent;\n    }\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements before text extraction\n    let cleaned = allArticleContent;\n    \n    // Remove style blocks\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove script blocks\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove donation sections\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*td-social[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*share[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove related posts sections\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*td_block_related[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove navigation sections\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*td-post-next-prev[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove comments sections\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<div[^>]*id=\"comments\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove figure elements (images will be extracted separately)\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<figure[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove iframes\n    cleaned = cleaned.replace(/<iframe[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/iframe>/gi, '');\n\n    // Extract images from (imgSrc.includes('.webp') || imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.png'))) {\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Strip all HTML tags\n    let textContent = cleaned.replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ');\n    \n    // Decode HTML entities\n    textContent = textContent\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')\n      .replace(/&#x27;/g, \"'\")\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—');\n    \n    // Collapse multiple spaces and newlines\n    textContent = textContent.replace(/\\s+/g, ' ').trim();\n    \n    // Calculate metrics\n    const wordCount = textContent.split(/\\s+/).filter(word => word.length > 0).length;\n    const characterCount = textContent.length;\n    const hasContent = textContent.length > 0;\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title,\n        url,\n        date,\n        thumbnail,\n        images,\n        source: 'European Spaceflight',\n        content: textContent,\n        raw_html_content: allArticleContent,\n        word_count: wordCount,\n        character_count: characterCount,\n        has_content: hasContent\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'European Spaceflight',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

              "jsCode": "// NASA Spaceflight Code Node - Extracts article content from NASASpaceFlight.com HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.article, item.json.data, or item.json.body containing full HTML response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, featured image, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Debug: Check what fields are available\n    let availableFields = Object.keys(item.json || item);\n    \n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || \n               item.data || item.body || item.article || item.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          debug_available_fields: availableFields,\n          debug_item_structure: JSON.stringify(item).substring(0, 500),\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'NSF',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*post-title[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from article:published_time (ISO format)\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"article:published_time\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    let date = '';\n    if (dateMatch) {\n      // Parse ISO date: \"2026-02-07T19:57:50+00:00\" -> \"February 7, 2026\"\n      let dateObj = new Date(dateMatch[1]);\n      let months = ['January', 'February', 'March', 'April', 'May', 'June', \n                    'July', 'August', 'September', 'October', 'November', 'December'];\n      date = months[dateObj.getMonth()] + ' ' + \n             dateObj.getDate() + ', ' + \n             dateObj.getFullYear();\n    }\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from inner-post-entry entry-content div\n    // Content ends before related posts (item-related) or comments (post-comments)\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"inner-post-entry entry-content\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>\\s*(?:<div class=\"(?:item-related|post-comments)|<\\/article>)/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove the penci-post-countview-number-check indicator\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<i class=\"penci-post-countview-number-check\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/i>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove the \"more\" anchor span\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<span id=\"more-[^\"]*\"><\\/span>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove embedded YouTube videos and other iframes\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*fluid-width-video-wrapper[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/g, '');\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<iframe[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/iframe>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove featured image credit lines at the end (starts with \"Featured Image:\")\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<p><em>Featured Image:[^<]*<\\/em><\\/p>/gi, '');\n    \n    // Remove inline ad content if any\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*penci-ads[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/g, '');\n\n    // Extract images from content (filter out tiny icons and data URIs)\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Only include actual images (not data URIs, not lazy placeholders, not shop banners)\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp')) &&\n          !imgSrc.includes('ShopBanner')) {\n        images.push(imgSrc);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .replace(/&hellip;/g, '…')                         // Ellipsis\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'NASASpaceFlight.com',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'NASASpaceFlight.com',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// Spaceflight Now Code Node - Extracts article content from Spaceflight Now HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.article, item.json.data, or item.json.body containing full HTML response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, thumbnail, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'Spaceflight Now',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with entry-title class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*entry-title[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from the article or use passed URL\n    // Try to find canonical URL or construct from article link\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from entry-meta-date span\n    // Format: Link text is \"February 8, 2026\"\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<span class=\"entry-meta-date[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<a[^>]*>([^<]+)<\\/a><\\/span>/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from first wp-image in entry-content\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<img[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*wp-image-[^\"]*\"[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from entry-content div\n    // Content ends before entry-tags div\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content clearfix\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/div>\\s*<div class=\"entry-tags/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove figure captions (photo credits)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<figcaption[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figcaption>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove entire figure elements with their enclosing tags, keeping just the img\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<figure[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/figure>/g, function(match, figureContent) {\n      // Extract just the img tag if present\n      let imgMatch = figureContent.match(/<img[^>]*>/);\n      return imgMatch ? imgMatch[0] : '';\n    });\n\n    // Extract images from content\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Only include actual content images\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp'))) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&#8216;/g, \"'\")                          // Left single quote\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'Spaceflight Now',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'Spaceflight Now',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// SpacePolicyOnline Code Node - Extracts article content from SpacePolicyOnline.com HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.article, item.json.data, or item.json.body containing full HTML response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, thumbnail, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'Space Policy Online',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with entry-title class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*entry-title[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from H5 with entry-date class\n    // Format: \"By Marcia Smith | Posted: February 6, 2026 5:49 pm ET | Last Updated: February 6, 2026 5:57 pm ET\"\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<h5[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*entry-date[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/h5>/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail - use first content image if available\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<img[^>]*src=\"(https:\\/\\/spacepolicyonline\\.com\\/wp-content\\/uploads\\/[^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from entry-content div\n    // Content ends before the \"updated\" section if present\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)(?:<div class=\"updated\">|$)/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove AddThis social sharing buttons\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div class=\"social\">[\\s\\S]*?<!-- AddThis Button END -->[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove AddToAny social sharing buttons\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div class=\"addtoany_share_save_container[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove Twitter/X embeds and scripts\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"[\\s\\S]*?<\\/blockquote>/g, '');\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<script[^>]*src=\"[^\"]*twitter\\.com\\/widgets\\.js\"[^>]*><\\/script>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove \"The text of the internal document was provided to SpacePolicyOnline.com\" statement\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<p>The text of the internal document was provided to SpacePolicyOnline\\.com[^<]*<\\/p>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove HTML comments\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<!--[\\s\\S]*?-->/g, '');\n\n    // Extract images from content (filter out tiny icons and social media images)\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Only include actual content images from their CDN\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          imgSrc.includes('spacepolicyonline.com/wp-content/uploads/') &&\n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp'))) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&#8216;/g, \"'\")                          // Left single quote\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'SpacePolicyOnline.com',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'SpacePolicyOnline.com',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, thumbnail, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'Space News',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with entry-title class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*entry-title[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from time element (display format)\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<time class=\"entry-date published\" datetime=\"[^\"]*\">([^<]+)<\\/time>/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag and remove query parameters\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from entry-content div\n    // Content ends before the jp-relatedposts section\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<div id='jp-relatedposts'/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove HTML comments\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<!--[\\s\\S]*?-->/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove social sharing buttons\n contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Only include actual images (not avatars,    !imgSrc.includes('avatar') && \n          !imgSrc.includes('gravatar')) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ') dash\n      .replace(/&#8216;/g, \"'\")                          // Left single quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Right single quote\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n HTML response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, featured image, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'Space Daily',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 tag\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1>([\\s\\S]*?)<br\\s*\\/?><\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from the byline (format: \"Location (Source) Month Day, Year\")\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<span class=\"BHS\">[^<]*\\(AFP\\)\\s+([A-Za-z]+\\s+\\d+,\\s+\\d{4})/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content\n    // Content starts after the byline and ends before \"<!--RELATED LINKS-->\"\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<!--body-2-incontainer\\.php-->\\n\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<!--RELATED LINKS-->/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove iframe ads\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<iframe[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/iframe>/g, '');\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove center tags around ads\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<center>\\s*<\\/center>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove line breaks and paragraph tags - they use <p> instead of </p>\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<p>\\s*\\\\r\\\\n/g, '\\n');\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/\\\\r\\\\n/g, '\\n');\n\n    // Extract images from content (filter out tiny icons, banners, and data URIs)\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Only include actual images (not data URIs, not sponsors/banners, not tiny spacer images)\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp')) &&\n          !imgSrc.includes('/sponsors/') &&\n          !imgSrc.includes('black.jpg') &&\n          !imgSrc.includes('white.jpg')) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\\\r\\\\n/g, '\\n')                          // Convert escaped line breaks\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'Space Scout',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'Space Scout',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

              "jsCode": "// Space Scout Code Node - Extracts article content from Space Scout HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.article, item.json.data, or item.json.body containing full HTML response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, featured image, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'Space Scout',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with cm-entry-title class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*cm-entry-title[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from time element (display format)\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<time class=\"entry-date published\" datetime=\"[^\"]*\">([^<]+)<\\/time>/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1].split('?')[0] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from cm-entry-summary div\n    // Content ends before closing article tag or related posts section\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"cm-entry-summary\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>\\s*<\\/article>/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove WordPress lazy-loading script comments\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<!--[\\s\\S]*?-->/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove figure captions (they're often credits, not content)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<figcaption[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figcaption>/g, '');\n\n    // Extract images from content (filter out tiny icons and data URIs)\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Remove resize and other query parameters (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp')) &&\n          !imgSrc.includes('gravatar.com')) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')
