              "jsCode": "// Get all input items from previous cleanup nodes\nconst items = $input.all();\n\n// Filter out items with errors (No HTML content found)\nconst validArticles = items.filter(item => {\n  const data = item.json;\n  return !data.error && data.has_content && data.title && data.content;\n});\n\n// If no valid articles found, return empty markdown\nif (validArticles.length === 0) {\n  return [{\n    json: {\n      combined_article_markdown: \"# Space News Digest\\n\\nNo articles available at this time.\",\n      article_count: 0\n    }\n  }];\n}\n\n// Build markdown document\nlet markdown = \"# Space News Digest\\n\\n\";\nmarkdown += `*Generated on ${new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-US', { \n  year: 'numeric', \n  month: 'long', \n  day: 'numeric' \n})}*\\n\\n`;\nmarkdown += `**Total Articles:** ${validArticles.length}\\n\\n`;\nmarkdown += \"---\\n\\n\";\n\n// Process each valid article\nvalidArticles.forEach((item, index) => {\n  const article = item.json;\n  \n  // Article title as heading with URL\n  if (article.url) {\n    markdown += `## ${index + 1}. [${article.title}](${article.url})\\n\\n`;\n  } else {\n    markdown += `## ${index + 1}. ${article.title}\\n\\n`;\n  }\n  \n  // Source and date metadata\n  const metaParts = [];\n  if (article.source) {\n    metaParts.push(`**Source:** ${article.source}`);\n  }\n  if (article.date) {\n    metaParts.push(`**Date:** ${article.date}`);\n  }\n  if (article.word_count) {\n    metaParts.push(`**Length:** ${article.word_count.toLocaleString()} words`);\n  }\n  \n  if (metaParts.length > 0) {\n    markdown += metaParts.join(\" | \") + \"\\n\\n\";\n  }\n  \n  // Featured/thumbnail image\n  if (article.thumbnail) {\n    markdown += `![Featured Image](${article.thumbnail})\\n\\n`;\n  }\n  \n  // Article content\n  if (article.content) {\n    markdown += article.content + \"\\n\\n\";\n  }\n  \n  // Additional images (excluding thumbnail)\n  if (article.images && article.images.length > 0) {\n    const additionalImages = article.images.filter(img => img !== article.thumbnail);\n    \n    if (additionalImages.length > 0) {\n      markdown += \"### Additional Images\\n\\n\";\n      additionalImages.forEach((imageUrl, imgIndex) => {\n        markdown += `![Image ${imgIndex + 1}](${imageUrl})\\n\\n`;\n      });\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Separator between articles\n  markdown += \"---\\n\\n\";\n});\n\n// Add footer\nmarkdown += \"*End Of Articles*\\n\";\n\n// Return single item with consolidated markdown\nreturn [{\n  json: {\n    combined_article_markdown: markdown,\n    article_count: validArticles.length,\n    sources: [...new Set(validArticles.map(item => item.json.source))],\n    total_words: validArticles.reduce((sum, item) => sum + (item.json.word_count || 0), 0),\n    generated_date: new Date().toISOString()\n  }\n}];\n",

          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// NASA Image Article Code Node - Extracts article content from NASA Image Article HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.article, item.json.data, or item.json.body containing full HTML response  \n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, thumbnail, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'NASA Image',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with display-48 class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*display-48[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url or canonical meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    if (!urlMatch) {\n      urlMatch = html.match(/<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    }\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from heading-12 span\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<span class=\"heading-12[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([^<]+)<\\/span>/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from entry-content div\n    // Content ends before edit-post-link div\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<div class=\"edit-post-link\">/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove figcaptions (image credits are repeated in text)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<figcaption[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figcaption>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove the featured image figure wrapper but keep the content\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div id=\"\" class=\"hds-media[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove credit lines at the end (Text credit, Image credit)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<p>\\s*<em>\\s*(Text credit|Image credit):[^<]*<\\/em>\\s*<\\/p>/gi, '');\n\n    // Extract images from content\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Remove query parameters from image URLs\n      imgSrc = imgSrc.split('?')[0];\n      // Only include actual content images\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp'))) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // If no images in content, use thumbnail\n    if (images.length === 0 && thumbnail) {\n      images.push(thumbnail.split('?')[0]);\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&#8216;/g, \"'\")                          // Left single quote\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail.split('?')[0],\n        images: images,\n        source: 'NASA Image',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'NASA Image',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// NASA Mission Article Code Node - Extracts article content from NASA Mission Article HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.article, item.json.data, or item.json.body containing full HTML response  \n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, thumbnail, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'NASA Mission',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with display-48 class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*display-48[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url or canonical meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    if (!urlMatch) {\n      urlMatch = html.match(/<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    }\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from heading-12 span\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<span class=\"heading-12[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([^<]+)<\\/span>/);\n    let date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from entry-content div\n    // Content ends before edit-post-link div\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<div class=\"edit-post-link\">/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove figcaptions (image credits)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<figcaption[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figcaption>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove the featured image figure wrapper\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div id=\"\" class=\"hds-media[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figure>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove related content cards at the end\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div class=\"hds-related-content-module[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/g, '');\n\n    // Extract images from content\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Remove query parameters from image URLs\n      imgSrc = imgSrc.split('?')[0];\n      // Only include actual content images\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp'))) {\n        // Don't add duplicates\n        if (!images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n          images.push(imgSrc);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // If no images in content, use thumbnail\n    if (images.length === 0 && thumbnail) {\n      images.push(thumbnail.split('?')[0]);\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&#8216;/g, \"'\")                          // Left single quote\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail ? thumbnail.split('?')[0] : '',\n        images: images,\n        source: 'NASA Mission',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'NASA Mission',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

  // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with display-48 class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*display-48[^\"]*\"[^>]*>\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ?   urlMatch = html.match(/<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"([^\"]+)\"\\s*\\/?>/);\n    }\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from heading-12 span\n entry-content div\n    // Content ends before edit-post-link div\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">\\s*([\\s\\S]*?)\\s*<div class=\"edit-post-link\">/);\n    let .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ') .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&#8216;/g, \"'\")                          // Left single quote\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                   {

                    "fullResponse": false,
                    "neverError": false,
                    "responseFormat": "text",
                    "outputPropertyName": "article"
                  }
                }
              },
              "infoMessage": ""
            },
            "type": "n8n-nodes-base.httpRequest",
            "typeVersion": 4.2,
            "position": [
              3408,
              2080
            ],
            "id": "6682cc57-1db3-4be5-a304-96775dc2e39c",
            "name": "Article Scrape13",
            "alwaysOutputData": true
          },
          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// NASA Blog Cleanup Code Node\n// Extracts and cleans article content from NASA Blog HTML scrapes\n// Input: item.json with HTML in article, data, body, or html field\n// Output: {title, url, date, thumbnail, images[], source, content, raw_html_content, word_count, character_count, has_content}\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get HTML content from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'NASA Blog',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with margin classes\n    const titleRegex = /<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*margin-bottom-[^\"]*\"[^>]*>(.*?)<\\/h1>/s;\n    const titleMatch = html.match(titleRegex);\n    const title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].replace(/<[^>]+>/g, '').trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url or canonical meta tag\n    const urlRegex = /<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"|<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"([^\"]+)\"/;\n    const urlMatch = html.match(urlRegex);\n    const url = urlMatch ? (urlMatch[1] || urlMatch[2]) : item.json.url || '';\n\n    // Extract date from time element in post-date div\n    const dateRegex = /<div class=\"post-date\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<time[^>]*datetime=\"([^\"]+)\">/;\n    const dateMatch = html.match(dateRegex);\n    const date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    const thumbnailRegex = /<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\"/;\n    const thumbnailMatch = html.match(thumbnailRegex);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract main content from single-blog-content div until mobile-credits\n    const contentStartRegex = /<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*single-blog-content[^\"]*\"[^>]*itemprop=\"articleBody\"[^>]*>/;\n    const contentStartMatch = html.match(contentStartRegex);\n    \n    let contentHtml = '';\n    if (contentStartMatch) {\n      const startIndex = contentStartMatch.index + contentStartMatch[0].length;\n      const afterStart = html.substring(startIndex);\n      \n      // Content ends at mobile-credits div\n      const endIndex = afterStart.search(/<div class=\"mobile-credits/);\n      contentHtml = endIndex > 0 ? afterStart.substring(0, endIndex) : afterStart;\n    }\n\n    // Remove the H1 title from content (it's already extracted)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<h1[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/h1>/, '');\n    \n    // Remove unwanted elements before text extraction\n    let cleaned = contentHtml\n      // Remove figcaptions (image credits)\n      .replace(/<figcaption[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figcaption>/gi, '')\n      // Remove featured image wrapper\n      .replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*hds-media[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>/gi, '')\n      // Remove text/image credit lines\n      .replace(/<p[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*wp-element-caption[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/p>/gi, '')\n      .replace(/Image credit:.*?(?=<|$)/gi, '')\n      .replace(/Photo credit:.*?(?=<|$)/gi, '')\n      // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '')\n      // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '');\n\n    // Extract all images from content (before cleaning HTML)\n    const images = [];\n    const imageRegex = /<img[^>]+src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g;\n    let imgMatch;\n    while ((imgMatch = imageRegex.exec(contentHtml)) !== null) {\n      let imgSrc = imgMatch[1];\n      // Strip query parameters\n      imgSrc = imgSrc.split('?')[0];\n      if (!images.includes(imgSrc) && !imgSrc.includes('gravatar')) {\n        images.push(imgSrc);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // If no content images found, use thumbnail as fallback\n    if (images.length === 0 && thumbnail) {\n      images.push(thumbnail.split('?')[0]);\n    }\n\n    // Strip query parameters from thumbnail\n    if (thumbnail) {\n      thumbnail = thumbnail.split('?')[0];\n    }\n\n    // Now clean up remaining HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = cleaned\n      .replace(/<br\\s*\\/?>/gi, '\\n')                   // Line breaks to newlines\n      .replace(/<\\/p>/gi, '\\n\\n')                       // Paragraphs to double newlines\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                         // Strip all HTML tags\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                          // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                           // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&#8220;|&#8221;|&ldquo;|&rdquo;/g, '\"') // Smart quotes\n      .replace(/&#8217;|&#8216;|&lsquo;|&rsquo;/g, \"'\") // Smart apostrophes\n      .replace(/&#8211;|&ndash;/g, .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'NASA Blog',\n cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'NASA Blog',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

          {
            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// The Planetary Society Cleanup Code Node\n// Extracts and cleans article content from The Planetary Society HTML scrapes\n// Input: item.json with HTML in article, data, body, or html field\n// Output: {title, url, date, thumbnail, images[], source, content, raw_html_content, word_count, character_count, has_content}\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get HTML content from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'The Planetary Society',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1\n    const titleRegex = /<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*mb-2[^\"]*\"[^>]*>(.*?)<\\/h1>/s;\n    const titleMatch = html.match(titleRegex);\n    const title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].replace(/<[^>]+>/g, '').trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url or canonical meta tag (handle different attribute orders)\n    const urlMatch = html.match(/<meta[^>]*property=\"og:url\"[^>]*content=\"([^\"]+)/) || \n                     html.match(/<meta[^>]*content=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*property=\"og:url\"/) ||\n                     html.match(/<link[^>]*rel=\"canonical\"[^>]*href=\"([^\"]+)\"/);\n    const url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : item.json.url || '';\n\n    // Extract date - it appears after the author name on a new line\n    const dateRegex = /<br>([A-Za-z]+ \\d{1,2}, \\d{4})<\\/p>/;\n    const dateMatch = html.match(dateRegex);\n    const date = dateMatch ? dateMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag (handle different attribute orders)\n    const thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta[^>]*property=\"og:image\"[^>]*content=\"([^\"]+)/) ||\n                          html.match(/<meta[^>]*content=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*property=\"og:image\"/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract main content from article tag\n    const articleStartRegex = /<article>/;\n    const articleStartMatch = html.match(articleStartRegex);\n    \n    let contentHtml = '';\n    if (articleStartMatch) {\n      const startIndex = articleStartMatch.index + articleStartMatch[0].length;\n      const afterStart = html.substring(startIndex);\n      \n      // Content ends at </article>\n      const endIndex = afterStart.search(/<\\/article>/);\n      contentHtml = endIndex > 0 ? afterStart.substring(0, endIndex) : afterStart;\n    }\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements before text extraction\n    let cleaned = contentHtml\n      // Remove the entire header section (includes author bio, date, H1)\n      .replace(/<header>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/header>/gi, '')\n      // Remove figcaptions (image credits)\n      .replace(/<figcaption[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/figcaption>/gi, '')\n      // Remove blockquotes (promotional content)\n      .replace(/<blockquote[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/blockquote>/gi, '')\n      // Remove author profile pictures\n      .replace(/<picture[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*rounded-full[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/picture>/gi, '')\n      // Remove \"Read our full guide!\" promotional section (last h2 + paragraph)\n      .replace(/<h2>Read our full guide!<\\/h2>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/p>/gi, '')\n      // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '')\n      // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')\n      // Remove footer content (related articles)\n      .replace(/<footer[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/footer>/gi, '');\n\n    // Extract all images from figure elements (excluding author headshots)\n    const images = [];\n    // Extract from data-srcset or src attributes in img tags\n    const imgRegex = /<img[^>]*(?:data-srcset|src)=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g;\n    let imgMatch;\n    while ((imgMatch = imgRegex.exec(contentHtml)) !== null) {\n      let imgSrc = imgMatch[1];\n      \n      // If it's a srcset, take the last (largest) image URL\n      if (imgSrc.includes(' ')) {\n        const srcsetParts = imgSrc.split(',');\n        imgSrc = srcsetParts[srcsetParts.length - 1].trim().split(' ')[0];\n      }\n      \n      // Remove the resize path component (e.g., _1200x799_crop_center-center_82_line/)\n      imgSrc = imgSrc.replace(/\\/_\\d+x\\d+_crop_[^/]+\\//, '/');\n      \n      // Remove numeric folder IDs (e.g., /778023/ or /826323/)\n      imgSrc = imgSrc.replace(/\\/\\d+\\//, '/');\n      \n      // Strip query parameters\n      imgSrc = imgSrc.split('?')[0];\n      \n      // Exclude author headshots and small profile images\n      if (!imgSrc.includes('headshot') && !imgSrc.includes('/_200x200_') && !images.includes(imgSrc)) {\n        images.push(imgSrc);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // If no content images found, use thumbnail as fallback\n    if (images.length === 0 && thumbnail) {\n      images.push(thumbnail.split('?')[0]);\n    }\n\n    // Strip query parameters from thumbnail\n    if (thumbnail) {\n      thumbnail = thumbnail.split('?')[0];\n    }\n\n    // Now clean up remaining HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = cleaned\n      .replace(/<br\\s*\\/?>/gi, '\\n')                   // Line breaks to newlines\n      .replace(/<\\/p>/gi, '\\n\\n')                       // Paragraphs to double newlines\n      .replace(/<\\/h[1-6]>/gi, '\\n\\n')                  // Headings to double newlines\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                         // Strip all HTML tags\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                          // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                           // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&#8220;|&#8221;|&ldquo;|&rdquo;/g, '\"') // Smart quotes\n      .replace(/&#8217;|&#8216;|&lsquo;|&rsquo;/g, \"'\") // Smart apostrophes\n      .replace(/&#8211;|&ndash;/g, '–')                 // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;|&mdash;/g, '—')                 // Em dash\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                            // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                            // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                          // Quote\n      .replace(/&#039;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                             // Collapse whitespace\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'The Planetary Society',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'The Planetary Society',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",

            "parameters": {
              "mode": "runOnceForAllItems",
              "language": "javaScript",
              "jsCode": "// NASA Code Node - Extracts article content from NASA Earth Observatory HTML\n// Expected input: item.json.data or item.json.body containing full HTML response\n// Expected output: Clean article with title, URL, date, featured image, content, images array\n\nlet items = $input.all();\nlet results = [];\n\nfor (let item of items) {\n  try {\n    // Get the HTML from various possible field names\n    let html = item.json.article || item.json.data || item.json.body || item.json.html || '';\n    \n    if (!html) {\n      results.push({\n        json: {\n          error: 'No HTML content found',\n          title: '',\n          url: item.json.url || '',\n          date: '',\n          thumbnail: '',\n          images: [],\n          source: 'NASA Science',\n          content: '',\n          raw_html_content: '',\n          word_count: 0,\n          character_count: 0,\n          has_content: false\n        }\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    // Extract title from H1 with display-48 class\n    let titleMatch = html.match(/<h1[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*display-48[^\"]*\"[^>]*>([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/h1>/);\n    let title = titleMatch ? titleMatch[1].trim() : '';\n\n    // Extract URL from og:url meta tag\n    let urlMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    let url = urlMatch ? urlMatch[1] : (item.json.url || '');\n\n    // Extract date from article:published_time (ISO format)\n    let dateMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"article:published_time\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    let date = '';\n    if (dateMatch) {\n      // Parse ISO date: \"2026-02-07T00:01:00-05:00\" -> \"Feb 07, 2026\"\n      let dateObj = new Date(dateMatch[1]);\n      let months = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'];\n      date = months[dateObj.getMonth()] + ' ' + \n             String(dateObj.getDate()).padStart(2, '0') + ', ' + \n             dateObj.getFullYear();\n    }\n\n    // Extract thumbnail from og:image meta tag\n    let thumbnailMatch = html.match(/<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"([^\"]+)\" ?\\/?>/);\n    let thumbnail = thumbnailMatch ? thumbnailMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Extract the main article content from entry-content div\n    let contentMatch = html.match(/<div class=\"entry-content\">([\\s\\S]*?)<\\/div><div id=\"\"/);\n    let contentHtml = contentMatch ? contentMatch[1] : '';\n\n    // Remove unwanted elements from content\n    // Remove \"Downloads\" section (hds-featured-file-list)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*hds-featured-file-list[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>\\s*<\\/div>/g, '');\n    \n    // Remove \"References\" section (if any - appears to be inline in content)\n    // Keep it for now as it seems to be part of the article\n    \n    // Remove hds-content-lists (related articles at bottom)\n    contentHtml = contentHtml.replace(/<div[^>]*class=\"[^\"]*hds-content-lists-inner[^\"]*\"[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?$/g, '');\n\n    // Extract images from content (filter out tiny icons and data URIs)\n    let imageMatches = contentHtml.matchAll(/<img[^>]*src=\"([^\"]+)\"[^>]*>/g);\n    let images = [];\n    for (let match of imageMatches) {\n      let imgSrc = match[1];\n      // Only include actual images (not data URIs, not lazy placeholders)\n      if (imgSrc.startsWith('http') && \n          (imgSrc.includes('.jpg') || imgSrc.includes('.jpeg') || \n           imgSrc.includes('.png') || imgSrc.includes('.webp'))) {\n        images.push(imgSrc);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean HTML tags and decode entities\n    let cleanContent = contentHtml\n      .replace(/<script[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/script>/gi, '') // Remove scripts\n      .replace(/<style[^>]*>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/style>/gi, '')   // Remove styles\n      .replace(/<[^>]+>/g, ' ')                          // Remove all HTML tags\n      .replace(/\\s+/g, ' ')                              // Normalize whitespace\n      .replace(/&#8220;/g, '\"')                          // Left curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8221;/g, '\"')                          // Right curly quote\n      .replace(/&#8217;/g, \"'\")                          // Apostrophe\n      .replace(/&#8211;/g, '–')                          // En dash\n      .replace(/&#8212;/g, '—')                          // Em dash\n      .replace(/&nbsp;/g, ' ')                           // Non-breaking space\n      .replace(/&amp;/g, '&')                            // Ampersand\n      .replace(/&lt;/g, '<')                             // Less than\n      .replace(/&gt;/g, '>')                             // Greater than\n      .replace(/&quot;/g, '\"')                           // Quote\n      .trim();\n\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        title: title,\n        url: url,\n        date: date,\n        thumbnail: thumbnail,\n        images: images,\n        source: 'NASA Earth Observatory',\n        content: cleanContent,\n        raw_html_content: contentHtml,\n        word_count: cleanContent.split(/\\s+/).length,\n        character_count: cleanContent.length,\n        has_content: cleanContent.length > 0\n      }\n    });\n\n  } catch (error) {\n    results.push({\n      json: {\n        error: error.message,\n        title: '',\n        url: item.json.url || '',\n        date: '',\n        thumbnail: '',\n        images: [],\n        source: 'NASA Earth Observatory',\n        content: '',\n        raw_html_content: '',\n        word_count: 0,\n        character_count: 0,\n        has_content: false\n      }\n    });\n  }\n}\n\nreturn results;\n",
